summary: This is an internal email correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding updates to the Ghislaine Maxwell victim information page. It provides information about victim attendance procedures and COVID-19 protocols for the Maxwell trial, which began with jury selection on November 29, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal trial for which this document provides victim attendance and COVID-19 protocol information.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Jury Selection Begins
events.description: Jury selection for the criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell began.

events.title: Court Order on Public Access Procedures
events.description: The S.D.N.Y. Court issued an order outlining procedures for public access to the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

events.title: Court Order on Public Access Procedures
events.description: The S.D.N.Y. Court issued an order outlining procedures for public access to the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

locations: S.D.N.Y. courthouse (Southern District of New York courthouse)
keyFacts: The criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell began with jury selection on November 29, 2021.
The court established specific procedures for victim attendance at the trial, coordinated through the U.S. Attorney's Office Victim-Witness Coordinator.
Strict COVID-19 protocols were in place for anyone entering the S.D.N.Y. courthouse, including a health questionnaire, temperature check, and mandatory mask-wearing.
The trial proceedings were available via live feed only within the courthouse itself (in the courtroom and overflow rooms), with no external broadcast or telephonic access.
